Class Score

  • java.lang.Object
    • Score
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Scorecard

    public class Score
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is pretty straight forward, it takes in the faces of the dice and scores them for each of the possible scoring categories. CPSC224, Spring 2020 No Sources to cite
    Version:
    v2.0 02/28/2020
    Author:
    Wesley Muehlhausen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int chanceLine()
      The chance line is the sum of all the single chance lines.
      int fourOfK()
      This method takes the logic from 3OK and checks one more element on top of that which then prints the result
      int fullHouse()
      fullHouse first finds three of a kind, and then if that is true, it then loops through again to find a pair of which is not the same value as the set of three.
      int indivChance(int pos)
      this function calculates and prints the score for each chance slot not to be confused with the total chance column.
      int largeStr()
      Same as the small straight method but has to be 5 in a row instead of 4
      void setupScore(int sides, int dice, int rolls)
      Similar to the setup hand method from the hand class, this method imports the same values except for the hand array of integers
      void showScore()
      This prints out the score for each turn by calling all of the below score methods
      int smallStr()
      checks for small straight by looping through and seeing if the following element is one larger than the current element.
      void sortScore()
      Sorts the hand so scoring functions work
      int threeOfK()
      This method finds three of a kind by looping through and checking if an element has the same value as both the elements before and after and also prints out the score
      void updateScore(int pos, int value)
      Updates the hand for scoring otherwise the scoring would score the previous hand
      int yahtzee()
      checks for yahtzee which is all the same.

      • Score

        public Score()
        Constructor for Score class

    • Method Detail

      • showScore

        public void showScore()
        This prints out the score for each turn by calling all of the below score methods

      • setupScore

        public void setupScore(int sides,
                       int dice,
                       int rolls)
        Similar to the setup hand method from the hand class, this method imports the same values except for the hand array of integers
        Parameters:
        dice - is the number of dice in play
        rolls - is the number of rolls per turn
        sides - is the number of sides on each die

      • updateScore

        public void updateScore(int pos,
                        int value)
        Updates the hand for scoring otherwise the scoring would score the previous hand
        Parameters:
        pos - is the index of where the value is loaded
        value - is the value which goes into the hand at the index position

      • sortScore

        public void sortScore()
        Sorts the hand so scoring functions work

      • threeOfK

        public int threeOfK()
        This method finds three of a kind by looping through and checking if an element has the same value as both the elements before and after and also prints out the score
        Returns:
        the score of the function

      • fourOfK

        public int fourOfK()
        This method takes the logic from 3OK and checks one more element on top of that which then prints the result
        Returns:
        the score of the function

      • fullHouse

        public int fullHouse()
        fullHouse first finds three of a kind, and then if that is true, it then loops through again to find a pair of which is not the same value as the set of three. Then prints it.
        Returns:
        the score of the function

      • smallStr

        public int smallStr()
        checks for small straight by looping through and seeing if the following element is one larger than the current element.
        Returns:
        the score of the function

      • largeStr

        public int largeStr()
        Same as the small straight method but has to be 5 in a row instead of 4
        Returns:
        the score of the function

      • yahtzee

        public int yahtzee()
        checks for yahtzee which is all the same. if one is not the same as another if will give a score of 0. This is not made for just 5 in a row, they all have to be the same
        Returns:
        the score of the function

      • indivChance

        public int indivChance(int pos)
        this function calculates and prints the score for each chance slot not to be confused with the total chance column.
        Parameters:
        pos - determines which individual chance line to score
        Returns:
        the score of the function

      • chanceLine

        public int chanceLine()
        The chance line is the sum of all the single chance lines. I have this as return type int instead of void because it is used as the score for some of the other methods too.
        Returns:
        num is the score on the chance line
